intro: Ceropegia somalica, commonly known as the Somalian arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia and neighboring countries. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant has adapted to harsh desert conditions with succulent leaves that store water and reduce transpiration. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and they emit a mild fragrance to attract pollinators. Ceropegia somalica is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
